intro: Sisymbrium tilingii, commonly known as the Turkish mustard, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to regions of southeastern Europe and western Asia, including parts of Turkey and the Caucasus. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are pinnately lobed and flowering stems with alternate, linear leaves. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in the summer months. The plant is known for its peppery scent and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
